name: Ammonium carb
Relationship: Inimical to LACHESIS. Similar in action. Antidotes: Arnica; Camphor. Compare: Rhus; Muriatic acid; Tartar emet. Of use in poisoning by charcoal fumes.
Modalities: Worse: and during 3 to four am
Better: lying on painful side and on stomach; in dry weather

Urine: Urine white, sandy, bloody, copious, turbid and fetid
Head: Pulsating forehead; better, pressure and in warm room
Shocks through head
Stomach: Pain at pit of stomach, with heartburn, nausea, water brash, and chilliness
Abdomen: Protruding piles, worse after stool, better lying down
Mouth: Great dryness of mouth and throat
Pressing teeth together sends shocks through head, eyes, and ears
Respiratory: Winter catarrh, with slimy sputum and specks of blood
Cough every morning about three o'clock, with dyspnoea, palpitation, burning in chest; worse ascending
Much oppression in breathing; worse after any effort, and entering warm room, or ascending even a few steps
Slow labored, stertorous breathing; bubbling sound
Eyes: Burning of eyes with aversion to light
Nose: Stoppage at night, with long-continued coryza
Epistaxis after washing and after eating
Ozaena, blows bloody mucus from nose
Male: Itching and pain of scrotum and spermatic cords
Ears: Shocks through ears, eyes, and nose, when gnashing teeth
Heart: Audible palpitation with fear, cold sweat, lachrymation, inability to speak, loud breathing and trembling hands
Heart weak, wakes with difficult breathing and palpitation
Mind: Talking and hearing others talk affects greatly
Forgetful, ill-humored, gloomy during stormy weather
Female: Menses too frequent, profuse, early, copious, clotted, black; colicky pains, and hard, difficult stool, with fatigue, especially of thighs; yawning and chilliness
Itching, swelling and burning of pudendum
Skin: Faintly developed eruptions from defective vitality
Erysipelas in the aged, with brain symptoms
Eczema in the bends of extremities, between legs, about anus and genitals
Throat: Tendency to gangrenous ulceration of tonsils
Enlarged tonsils and glands of neck
Diphtheria when nose is stopped up
Extremities: Hands cold and blue; distended veins
Fingers swell when arm is hanging down
Tearing in ankle and bones of feet, better when warm in bed
Tearing in joints relieved by heat of bed; inclination to stretch limbs

dosage: Lower potencies deteriorate with age. Sixth potency best for general use.
